name: .NASM File Extension
summary: Learn about .NASM files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An NASM file is a source code file written for the Netwide Assembler (NASM), a widely used assembler for the x86 (32-bit) and x86-64 (64-bit) architectures. It contains human-readable assembly language instructions that define how a program interacts with computer hardware. NASM files may include directives, labels, macros, and comments in addition to executable instructions.

content: Developers write NASM files when creating software that requires precise control over processor operations, memory, or performance. The NASM assembler assembles the source code stored in an NASM file into an object file or a final executable program, depending on the build process. The resulting output may be a standalone binary, a part of a larger program, or system-level code, such as bootloaders and operating system kernels.

NASM is an open-source assembler, making it popular among students, hobbyists, and professionals who need to work with low-level programming. Users of NASM files typically include operating system developers, systems programmers, and those studying computer architecture.

NOTE: NASM files are similar to .ASM files. However, ASM files are generic assembly source files that can be used with different assemblers, while NASM files are specifically written in NASM syntax for the Netwide Assembler.

instructions: You can open NASM files with any text or source code editor, such as Microsoft Notepad, Apple TextEdit, and Microsoft Visual Studio Code. You can also assemble the code in an NASM file with Netwide Assembler.
